term.name: transcendentalism
term.source: From Latin transcendentalis: going beyond or above something.
term.def: Any approach to philosophy holding that there is an aspect of reality higher than the physical world of perception and experience; another term for &idealism;, often used to refer to &kantianism; or even &spiritualism;.

A school of 19th century American philosophy exemplified by Ralph Waldo Emerson (1803-1882) and Henry David Thoreau (1817-1862); it advocated a combination of &optimism; and &individualism; that emphasized self-reliance and self-fulfillment in harmony with nature and humanistic ideals.
